summary: This code starts Emacs, a popular text editor, with the "-q" option to prevent loading default initialization files and "-l async.el" option to load the "async.el" Emacs Lisp script for asynchronous operations. The "--script" command tells Emacs to run the specified Elisp script (async.el) instead of waiting for user input. This is used for automating certain tasks in Emacs.
